segment.source: Compatibility Fixes for Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, and Windows Vista (Windows 10)
segment.target: Compatibility Fixes for Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, and Windows Vista (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can fix some compatibility issues that are due to the changes made between Windows operating system versions.
segment.target: You can fix some compatibility issues that are due to the changes made between Windows operating system versions.

segment.source: These issues can include User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.
segment.target: These issues can include User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.

segment.source: Compatibility Fixes for Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, and Windows Vista
segment.target: Compatibility Fixes for Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, and Windows Vista

segment.target: Applies to

segment.target: Windows 10

segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.target: Windows 8

segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: You can fix some compatibility issues that are due to the changes made between Windows operating system versions.
segment.target: You can fix some compatibility issues that are due to the changes made between Windows operating system versions.

segment.source: These issues can include User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.
segment.target: These issues can include User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: You must use the 32-bit version for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to work for 64-bit applications.
segment.target: You must use the 32-bit version for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to work for 64-bit applications.

segment.source: You will receive an error message if you try to use the wrong version.
segment.target: You will receive an error message if you try to use the wrong version.

segment.source: If you start the Compatibility Administrator as an Administrator (with elevated privileges), all repaired applications can run successfully; however, virtualization and redirection might not occur as expected.
segment.target: If you start the Compatibility Administrator as an Administrator (with elevated privileges), all repaired applications can run successfully; however, virtualization and redirection might not occur as expected.

segment.source: To verify that a compatibility fix addresses an issue, you must test the repaired application by running it under the destination user account.
segment.target: To verify that a compatibility fix addresses an issue, you must test the repaired application by running it under the destination user account.

segment.source: Compatibility Fixes
segment.target: Compatibility Fixes

segment.source: The following table lists the known compatibility fixes for all Windows operating systems that have been released from Windows Vista through Windows 10.
segment.target: The following table lists the known compatibility fixes for all Windows operating systems that have been released from Windows Vista through Windows 10.

segment.source: The fixes are listed in alphabetical order.
segment.target: The fixes are listed in alphabetical order.

segment.source: Fix
segment.target: Fix

segment.source: Fix Description
segment.target: Fix Description

segment.source: 8And16BitAggregateBlts
segment.target: 8And16BitAggregateBlts

segment.source: Applications that are mitigated by 8/16-bit mitigation can exhibit performance issues.
segment.target: Applications that are mitigated by 8/16-bit mitigation can exhibit performance issues.

segment.source: This layer aggregates all the blt operations and improves performance.
segment.target: This layer aggregates all the blt operations and improves performance.

segment.source: 8And16BitDXMaxWinMode
segment.target: 8And16BitDXMaxWinMode

segment.source: Applications that use DX8/9 and are mitigated by the 8/16-bit mitigation are run in a maximized windowed mode.
segment.target: Applications that use DX8/9 and are mitigated by the 8/16-bit mitigation are run in a maximized windowed mode.

segment.source: This layer mitigates applications that exhibit graphical corruption in full screen mode.
segment.target: This layer mitigates applications that exhibit graphical corruption in full screen mode.

segment.source: 8And16BitGDIRedraw
segment.target: 8And16BitGDIRedraw

segment.source: This fix repairs applications that use GDI and that work in 8-bit color mode.
segment.target: This fix repairs applications that use GDI and that work in 8-bit color mode.

segment.source: The application is forced to repaint its window on RealizePalette.
segment.target: The application is forced to repaint its window on RealizePalette.

segment.source: AccelGdipFlush
segment.target: AccelGdipFlush

segment.source: This fix increases the speed of GdipFlush, which has perf issues in DWM.
segment.target: This fix increases the speed of GdipFlush, which has perf issues in DWM.

segment.source: AoaMp4Converter
segment.target: AoaMp4Converter

segment.source: This fix resolves a display issue for the AoA Mp4 Converter.
segment.target: This fix resolves a display issue for the AoA Mp4 Converter.

segment.source: BIOSRead
segment.target: BIOSRead

segment.source: This problem is indicated when an application cannot access the Device\PhysicalMemory object beyond the kernel-mode drivers, on any of the Windows Server® 2003 operating systems.
segment.target: This problem is indicated when an application cannot access the Device\PhysicalMemory object beyond the kernel-mode drivers, on any of the Windows Server® 2003 operating systems.

segment.source: The fix enables OEM executable (.exe) files to use the GetSystemFirmwareTable function instead of the NtOpenSection function when the BIOS is queried for the Device\Physical memory information..
segment.target: The fix enables OEM executable (.exe) files to use the GetSystemFirmwareTable function instead of the NtOpenSection function when the BIOS is queried for the Device\Physical memory information..

segment.source: BlockRunasInteractiveUser
segment.target: BlockRunasInteractiveUser

segment.source: This problem occurs when InstallShield creates installers and uninstallers that fail to complete and that generate error messages or warnings.
segment.target: This problem occurs when InstallShield creates installers and uninstallers that fail to complete and that generate error messages or warnings.

segment.source: The fix blocks InstallShield from setting the value of RunAs registry keys to InteractiveUser Because InteractiveUser no longer has Administrator rights.
segment.target: The fix blocks InstallShield from setting the value of RunAs registry keys to InteractiveUser Because InteractiveUser no longer has Administrator rights.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the BlockRunAsInteractiveUser Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the BlockRunAsInteractiveUser Fix.

segment.source: ChangeFolderPathToXPStyle
segment.target: ChangeFolderPathToXPStyle

segment.source: This fix is required when an application cannot return shell folder paths when it uses the SHGetFolder API.
segment.target: This fix is required when an application cannot return shell folder paths when it uses the SHGetFolder API.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the SHGetFolder path request to the common appdata file path and returns the Windows® XP-style file path instead of the Windows Vista-style file path.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the SHGetFolder path request to the common appdata file path and returns the Windows® XP-style file path instead of the Windows Vista-style file path.

segment.source: ClearLastErrorStatusonIntializeCriticalSection
segment.target: ClearLastErrorStatusonIntializeCriticalSection

segment.source: This fix is indicated when an application fails to start.
segment.target: This fix is indicated when an application fails to start.

segment.source: The fix modifies the InitializeCriticalSection function call so that it checks the NTSTATUS error code, and then sets the last error to ERROR_SUCCESS.
segment.target: The fix modifies the InitializeCriticalSection function call so that it checks the NTSTATUS error code, and then sets the last error to ERROR_SUCCESS.

segment.source: CopyHKCUSettingsFromOtherUsers
segment.target: CopyHKCUSettingsFromOtherUsers

segment.source: This problem occurs when an application's installer must run in elevated mode and depends on the HKCU settings that are provided for other users.
segment.target: This problem occurs when an application's installer must run in elevated mode and depends on the HKCU settings that are provided for other users.

segment.source: The fix scans the existing user profiles and tries to copy the specified keys into the HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry area.
segment.target: The fix scans the existing user profiles and tries to copy the specified keys into the HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry area.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by entering the relevant registry keys as parameters that are separated by the ^ Symbol; for example: .
segment.target: You can control this fix further by entering the relevant registry keys as parameters that are separated by the ^ Symbol; for example: .

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the CopyHKCUSettingsFromOtherUsers Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the CopyHKCUSettingsFromOtherUsers Fix.

segment.source: CorrectCreateBrushIndirectHatch
segment.target: CorrectCreateBrushIndirectHatch

segment.source: The problem is indicated by an access violation error message that displays and when the application fails when you select or crop an image.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by an access violation error message that displays and when the application fails when you select or crop an image.

segment.source: The fix corrects the brush style hatch value, which is passed to the CreateBrushIndirect() function and enables the information to be correctly interpreted.
segment.target: The fix corrects the brush style hatch value, which is passed to the CreateBrushIndirect() function and enables the information to be correctly interpreted.

segment.source: CorrectFilePaths
segment.target: CorrectFilePaths

segment.source: The problem is indicated when an application tries to write files to the hard disk and is denied access or receives a file not found or path not found error message.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when an application tries to write files to the hard disk and is denied access or receives a file not found or path not found error message.

segment.source: The fix modifies the file path names to point to a new location on the hard disk.
segment.target: The fix modifies the file path names to point to a new location on the hard disk.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about the CorrectFilePaths application fix, see Using the CorrectFilePaths Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about the CorrectFilePaths application fix, see Using the CorrectFilePaths Fix.

segment.source: We recommend that you use this fix together with the CorrectFilePathsUninstall fix if you are applying it to a setup installation file.
segment.target: We recommend that you use this fix together with the CorrectFilePathsUninstall fix if you are applying it to a setup installation file.

segment.source: CorrectFilePathsUninstall
segment.target: CorrectFilePathsUninstall

segment.source: This problem occurs when an uninstalled application leaves behind files, directories, and links.
segment.target: This problem occurs when an uninstalled application leaves behind files, directories, and links.

segment.source: The fix corrects the file paths that are used by the uninstallation process of an application.
segment.target: The fix corrects the file paths that are used by the uninstallation process of an application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this fix, see Using the CorrectFilePathsUninstall Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this fix, see Using the CorrectFilePathsUninstall Fix.

segment.source: We recommend that you use this fix together with the CorrectFilePaths fix if you are applying it to a setup installation file.
segment.target: We recommend that you use this fix together with the CorrectFilePaths fix if you are applying it to a setup installation file.

segment.source: CorrectShellExecuteHWND
segment.target: CorrectShellExecuteHWND

segment.source: This problem occurs when you start an executable (.exe) and a taskbar item blinks instead of an elevation prompt being opened, or when the application does not provide a valid HWND value when it calls the ShellExecute(Ex) function.
segment.target: This problem occurs when you start an executable (.exe) and a taskbar item blinks instead of an elevation prompt being opened, or when the application does not provide a valid HWND value when it calls the ShellExecute(Ex) function.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the ShellExecute(Ex) calls, and then inspects the HWND value.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the ShellExecute(Ex) calls, and then inspects the HWND value.

segment.source: If the value is invalid, this fix enables the call to use the currently active HWND value.
segment.target: If the value is invalid, this fix enables the call to use the currently active HWND value.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about the CorrectShellExecuteHWND application fix, see Using the CorrectShellExecuteHWND Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about the CorrectShellExecuteHWND application fix, see Using the CorrectShellExecuteHWND Fix.

segment.source: CustomNCRender
segment.target: CustomNCRender

segment.source: This fix instructs DWM to not render the non-client area, thereby forcing the application to do its own NC rendering.
segment.target: This fix instructs DWM to not render the non-client area, thereby forcing the application to do its own NC rendering.

segment.source: This often gives windows an XP look.
segment.target: This often gives windows an XP look.

segment.source: DelayApplyFlag
segment.target: DelayApplyFlag

segment.source: This fix applies a KERNEL, USER, or PROCESS flag if the specified DLL is loaded.
segment.target: This fix applies a KERNEL, USER, or PROCESS flag if the specified DLL is loaded.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: DLL_Name;Flag_Type;Hexidecimal_Value
segment.target: DLL_Name;Flag_Type;Hexidecimal_Value

segment.source: Where the DLL_Name is the name of the specific DLL, including the file extension.
segment.target: Where the DLL_Name is the name of the specific DLL, including the file extension.

segment.source: Flag_Type is KERNEL, USER, or PROCESS, and a Hexidecimal_Value, starting with 0x and up to 64-bits long.
segment.target: Flag_Type is KERNEL, USER, or PROCESS, and a Hexidecimal_Value, starting with 0x and up to 64-bits long.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The PROCESS flag type can have a 32-bit length only.
segment.target: The PROCESS flag type can have a 32-bit length only.

segment.source: You can separate multiple entries with a backslash ().
segment.target: You can separate multiple entries with a backslash ().

segment.source: DeprecatedServiceShim
segment.target: DeprecatedServiceShim

segment.source: The problem is indicated when an application tries to install a service that has a dependency on a deprecated service.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when an application tries to install a service that has a dependency on a deprecated service.

segment.source: An error message displays.
segment.target: An error message displays.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the CreateService function calls and removes the deprecated dependency service from the lpDependencies parameter.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the CreateService function calls and removes the deprecated dependency service from the lpDependencies parameter.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: Deprecated_Service\App_Service/Deprecated_Service2 \App_Service2
segment.target: Deprecated_Service\App_Service/Deprecated_Service2 \App_Service2

segment.source: Where Deprecated_Service is the name of the service that has been deprecated and App_Service is the name of the specific application service that is to be modified; for example, NtLmSsp\WMI.
segment.target: Where Deprecated_Service is the name of the service that has been deprecated and App_Service is the name of the specific application service that is to be modified; for example, NtLmSsp\WMI.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you do not provide an App_Service name, the deprecated service will be removed from all newly created services.
segment.target: If you do not provide an App_Service name, the deprecated service will be removed from all newly created services.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can separate multiple entries with a forward slash (/).
segment.target: You can separate multiple entries with a forward slash (/).

segment.source: DirectXVersionLie
segment.target: DirectXVersionLie

segment.source: This problem occurs when an application fails because it does not find the correct version number for DirectX®.
segment.target: This problem occurs when an application fails because it does not find the correct version number for DirectX®.

segment.source: The fix modifies the DXDIAGN GetProp function call to return the correct DirectX version.
segment.target: The fix modifies the DXDIAGN GetProp function call to return the correct DirectX version.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: MAJORVERSION.MINORVERSION.LETTER
segment.target: MAJORVERSION.MINORVERSION.LETTER

segment.source: For example, .
segment.target: For example, .

segment.source: DetectorDWM8And16Bit
segment.target: DetectorDWM8And16Bit

segment.source: This fix offeres mitigation for applications that work in 8/16-bit display color mode because these legacy color modes are not supported in Windows 8 .
segment.target: This fix offeres mitigation for applications that work in 8/16-bit display color mode because these legacy color modes are not supported in Windows 8 .

segment.source: Disable8And16BitD3D
segment.target: Disable8And16BitD3D

segment.source: This fix improves performance of 8/16-bit color applications that render using D3D and do not mix directdraw.
segment.target: This fix improves performance of 8/16-bit color applications that render using D3D and do not mix directdraw.

segment.source: Disable8And16BitModes
segment.target: Disable8And16BitModes

segment.source: This fix disables 8/16-bit color mitigation and enumeration of 8/16-bit color modes.
segment.target: This fix disables 8/16-bit color mitigation and enumeration of 8/16-bit color modes.

segment.source: DisableDWM
segment.target: DisableDWM

segment.source: The problem occurs when some objects are not drawn or object artifacts remain on the screen in an application.
segment.target: The problem occurs when some objects are not drawn or object artifacts remain on the screen in an application.

segment.source: The fix temporarily disables the Windows Aero menu theme functionality for unsupported applications.
segment.target: The fix temporarily disables the Windows Aero menu theme functionality for unsupported applications.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the DisableDWM Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the DisableDWM Fix.

segment.source: DisableFadeAnimations
segment.target: DisableFadeAnimations

segment.source: The problem is indicated when an application fade animations, buttons, or other controls do not function properly.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when an application fade animations, buttons, or other controls do not function properly.

segment.source: The fix disables the fade animations functionality for unsupported applications.
segment.target: The fix disables the fade animations functionality for unsupported applications.

segment.source: DisableThemeMenus
segment.target: DisableThemeMenus

segment.source: The problem is indicated by an application that behaves unpredictably when it tries to detect and use the correct Windows settings.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by an application that behaves unpredictably when it tries to detect and use the correct Windows settings.

segment.source: The fix temporarily disables the Windows Aero menu theme functionality for unsupported applications.
segment.target: The fix temporarily disables the Windows Aero menu theme functionality for unsupported applications.

segment.source: DisableWindowsDefender
segment.target: DisableWindowsDefender

segment.source: The fix disables Windows Defender for security applications that do not work with Windows Defender.
segment.target: The fix disables Windows Defender for security applications that do not work with Windows Defender.

segment.source: DWM8And16BitMitigation
segment.target: DWM8And16BitMitigation

segment.source: The fix offers mitigation for applications that work in 8/16-bit display color mode because these legacy color modes are not supported in Windows 8.
segment.target: The fix offers mitigation for applications that work in 8/16-bit display color mode because these legacy color modes are not supported in Windows 8.

segment.source: DXGICompat
segment.target: DXGICompat

segment.source: The fix allows application-specific compatibility instructions to be passed to the DirectX engine.
segment.target: The fix allows application-specific compatibility instructions to be passed to the DirectX engine.

segment.source: DXMaximizedWindowedMode
segment.target: DXMaximizedWindowedMode

segment.source: Applications that use DX8/9 are run in a maximized windowed mode.
segment.target: Applications that use DX8/9 are run in a maximized windowed mode.

segment.source: This is required for applications that use GDI/DirectDraw in addition to Direct3D.
segment.target: This is required for applications that use GDI/DirectDraw in addition to Direct3D.

segment.source: ElevateCreateProcess
segment.target: ElevateCreateProcess

segment.source: The problem is indicated when installations, de-installations, or updates fail because the host process calls the CreateProcess function and it returns an ERROR_ELEVATION_REQUIRED error message.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when installations, de-installations, or updates fail because the host process calls the CreateProcess function and it returns an ERROR_ELEVATION_REQUIRED error message.

segment.source: The fix handles the error code and attempts to recall the CreateProcess function together with requested elevation.
segment.target: The fix handles the error code and attempts to recall the CreateProcess function together with requested elevation.

segment.source: If the fixed application already has a UAC manifest, the error code will be returned unchanged.
segment.target: If the fixed application already has a UAC manifest, the error code will be returned unchanged.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the ElevateCreateProcess Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the ElevateCreateProcess Fix.

segment.source: EmulateOldPathIsUNC
segment.target: EmulateOldPathIsUNC

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application fails because of an incorrect UNC path.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails because of an incorrect UNC path.

segment.source: The fix changes the PathIsUNC function to return a value of True for UNC paths in Windows.
segment.target: The fix changes the PathIsUNC function to return a value of True for UNC paths in Windows.

segment.source: EmulateGetDiskFreeSpace
segment.target: EmulateGetDiskFreeSpace

segment.source: The problem is indicated when an application fails to install or to run, and it generates an error message that there is not enough free disk space to install or use the application, even though there is enough free disk space to meet the application requirements.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when an application fails to install or to run, and it generates an error message that there is not enough free disk space to install or use the application, even though there is enough free disk space to meet the application requirements.

segment.source: The fix determines the amount of free space, so that if the amount of free space is larger than 2 GB, the compatibility fix returns a value of 2 GB, but if the amount of free space is smaller than 2 GB, the compatibility fix returns the actual free space amount.
segment.target: The fix determines the amount of free space, so that if the amount of free space is larger than 2 GB, the compatibility fix returns a value of 2 GB, but if the amount of free space is smaller than 2 GB, the compatibility fix returns the actual free space amount.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the EmulateGetDiskFreeSpace Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the EmulateGetDiskFreeSpace Fix.

segment.source: EmulateSorting
segment.target: EmulateSorting

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application experiences search functionality issues.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application experiences search functionality issues.

segment.source: The fix forces applications that use the CompareStringW/LCMapString sorting table to use an older version of the table.
segment.target: The fix forces applications that use the CompareStringW/LCMapString sorting table to use an older version of the table.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this e application fix, see Using the EmulateSorting Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this e application fix, see Using the EmulateSorting Fix.

segment.source: EmulateSortingWindows61
segment.target: EmulateSortingWindows61

segment.source: The fix emulates the sorting order of Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 for various APIs.
segment.target: The fix emulates the sorting order of Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 for various APIs.

segment.source: EnableRestarts
segment.target: EnableRestarts

segment.source: The problem is indicated when an application and computer appear to hang because processes cannot end to allow the computer to complete its restart processes.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when an application and computer appear to hang because processes cannot end to allow the computer to complete its restart processes.

segment.source: The fix enables the computer to restart and finish the installation process by verifying and enabling that the SeShutdownPrivilege service privilege exists.
segment.target: The fix enables the computer to restart and finish the installation process by verifying and enabling that the SeShutdownPrivilege service privilege exists.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the EnableRestarts Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the EnableRestarts Fix.

segment.source: ExtraAddRefDesktopFolder
segment.target: ExtraAddRefDesktopFolder

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application invokes the Release() method too many times and causes an object to be prematurely destroyed.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application invokes the Release() method too many times and causes an object to be prematurely destroyed.

segment.source: The fix counteracts the application's tries to obtain the shell desktop folder by invoking the AddRef() method on the Desktop folder, which is returned by the SHGetDesktopFolder function.
segment.target: The fix counteracts the application's tries to obtain the shell desktop folder by invoking the AddRef() method on the Desktop folder, which is returned by the SHGetDesktopFolder function.

segment.source: FailObsoleteShellAPIs
segment.target: FailObsoleteShellAPIs

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application fails because it generated deprecated API calls.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails because it generated deprecated API calls.

segment.source: The fix either fully implements the obsolete functions or implements the obsolete functions with stubs that fail.
segment.target: The fix either fully implements the obsolete functions or implements the obsolete functions with stubs that fail.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can type FailAll=1 at the command prompt to suppress the function implementation and force all functions to fail.
segment.target: You can type FailAll=1 at the command prompt to suppress the function implementation and force all functions to fail.

segment.source: FailRemoveDirectory
segment.target: FailRemoveDirectory

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application uninstallation process does not remove all of the application files and folders.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application uninstallation process does not remove all of the application files and folders.

segment.source: This fix fails calls to RemoveDirectory() when called with a path matching the one specified in the shim command-line.
segment.target: This fix fails calls to RemoveDirectory() when called with a path matching the one specified in the shim command-line.

segment.source: Only a single path is supported.
segment.target: Only a single path is supported.

segment.source: The path can contain environment variables, but must be an exact path – no partial paths are supported.
segment.target: The path can contain environment variables, but must be an exact path – no partial paths are supported.

segment.source: The fix can resolve an issue where an application expects RemoveDirectory() to delete a folder immediately even though a handle is open to it.
segment.target: The fix can resolve an issue where an application expects RemoveDirectory() to delete a folder immediately even though a handle is open to it.

segment.source: FakeLunaTheme
segment.target: FakeLunaTheme

segment.source: The problem occurs when a theme application does not properly display: the colors are washed out or the user interface is not detailed.
segment.target: The problem occurs when a theme application does not properly display: the colors are washed out or the user interface is not detailed.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the GetCurrentThemeName API and returns the value for the Windows XP default theme, (Luna).
segment.target: The fix intercepts the GetCurrentThemeName API and returns the value for the Windows XP default theme, (Luna).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about the FakeLunaTheme application fix, see Using the FakeLunaTheme Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about the FakeLunaTheme application fix, see Using the FakeLunaTheme Fix.

segment.source: FlushFile
segment.target: FlushFile

segment.source: This problem is indicated when a file is updated and changes do not immediately appear on the hard disk.
segment.target: This problem is indicated when a file is updated and changes do not immediately appear on the hard disk.

segment.source: Applications cannot see the file changes.
segment.target: Applications cannot see the file changes.

segment.source: The fix enables the WriteFile function to call to the FlushFileBuffers APIs, which flush the file cache onto the hard disk.
segment.target: The fix enables the WriteFile function to call to the FlushFileBuffers APIs, which flush the file cache onto the hard disk.

segment.source: FontMigration
segment.target: FontMigration

segment.source: The fix replaces an application-requested font with a better font selection, to avoid text truncation.
segment.target: The fix replaces an application-requested font with a better font selection, to avoid text truncation.

segment.source: ForceAdminAccess
segment.target: ForceAdminAccess

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application fails to function during an explicit administrator check.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails to function during an explicit administrator check.

segment.source: The fix allows the user to temporarily imitate being a part of the Administrators group by returning a value of True during the administrator check.
segment.target: The fix allows the user to temporarily imitate being a part of the Administrators group by returning a value of True during the administrator check.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the ForceAdminAccess Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the ForceAdminAccess Fix.

segment.source: ForceInvalidateOnClose
segment.target: ForceInvalidateOnClose

segment.source: The fix invalidates any windows that exist under a closing or hiding window for applications that rely on the invalidation messages.
segment.target: The fix invalidates any windows that exist under a closing or hiding window for applications that rely on the invalidation messages.

segment.source: FreestyleBMX
segment.target: FreestyleBMX

segment.target: The fix resolves an application race condition that is related to window message order.

segment.source: GetDriveTypeWHook
segment.target: GetDriveTypeWHook

segment.target: The application presents unusual behavior during installation; for example, the setup program states that it cannot install to a user-specified location.

segment.source: The fix changes GetDriveType() so that only the root information appears for the file path.
segment.target: The fix changes GetDriveType() so that only the root information appears for the file path.

segment.source: This is required when an application passes an incomplete or badly-formed file path when it tries to retrieve the drive type on which the file path exists.
segment.target: This is required when an application passes an incomplete or badly-formed file path when it tries to retrieve the drive type on which the file path exists.

segment.source: GlobalMemoryStatusLie
segment.target: GlobalMemoryStatusLie

segment.target: The problem is indicated by a Computer memory full error message that displays when you start an application.

segment.target: The fix modifies the memory status structure, so that it reports a swap file that is 400 MB, regardless of the true swap file size.

segment.source: HandleBadPtr
segment.target: HandleBadPtr

segment.target: The problem is indicated by an access violation error message that displays because an API is performing pointer validation before it uses a parameter.

segment.target: The fix supports using lpBuffer validation from the InternetSetOptionA and InternetSetOptionW functions to perform the additional parameter validation.

segment.source: HandleMarkedContentNotIndexed
segment.target: HandleMarkedContentNotIndexed

segment.source: The problem is indicated by an application that fails when it changes an attribute on a file or directory.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by an application that fails when it changes an attribute on a file or directory.

segment.source: The fix intercepts any API calls that return file attributes and directories that are invoked from the %TEMP% directory, and resets the FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NOT_CONTENT_INDEXED attribute to its original state.
segment.target: The fix intercepts any API calls that return file attributes and directories that are invoked from the %TEMP% directory, and resets the FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NOT_CONTENT_INDEXED attribute to its original state.

segment.target: HeapClearAllocation

segment.target: The problem is indicated when the allocation process shuts down unexpectedly.

segment.target: The fix uses zeros to clear out the heap allocation for an application.

segment.target: IgnoreAltTab

segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails to function when special key combinations are used.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the RegisterRawInputDevices API and prevents the delivery of the WM_INPUT messages.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the RegisterRawInputDevices API and prevents the delivery of the WM_INPUT messages.

segment.source: This delivery failure forces the included hooks to be ignored and forces DInput to use Windows-specific hooks.
segment.target: This delivery failure forces the included hooks to be ignored and forces DInput to use Windows-specific hooks.

segment.target: Note

segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the IgnoreAltTab Fix.

segment.target: IgnoreChromeSandbox

segment.target: The fix allows Google Chrome to run on systems that have ntdll loaded above 4GB.

segment.source: IgnoreDirectoryJunction
segment.target: IgnoreDirectoryJunction

segment.target: The problem is indicated by a read or access violation error message that displays when an application tries to find or open files.

segment.source: The fix links the FindNextFileW, FindNextFileA, FindFirstFileExW, FindFirstFileExA, FindFirstFileW and FindFirstFileA APIs to prevent them from returning directory junctions.
segment.target: The fix links the FindNextFileW, FindNextFileA, FindFirstFileExW, FindFirstFileExA, FindFirstFileW and FindFirstFileA APIs to prevent them from returning directory junctions.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Symbolic links appear starting in Windows Vista.
segment.target: Symbolic links appear starting in Windows Vista.

segment.source: IgnoreException
segment.target: IgnoreException

segment.source: The problem is indicated when an application stops functioning immediately after it starts, or the application starts with only a cursor appearing on the screen.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when an application stops functioning immediately after it starts, or the application starts with only a cursor appearing on the screen.

segment.source: The fix enables the application to ignore specified exceptions.
segment.target: The fix enables the application to ignore specified exceptions.

segment.source: By default, this fix ignores privileged-mode exceptions; however, it can be configured to ignore any exception.
segment.target: By default, this fix ignores privileged-mode exceptions; however, it can be configured to ignore any exception.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: Exception1;Exception2
segment.target: Exception1;Exception2

segment.source: Where Exception1 and Exception2 are specific exceptions to be ignored.
segment.target: Where Exception1 and Exception2 are specific exceptions to be ignored.

segment.source: For example: ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ:1;ACCESS_VIOLATION_WRITE:1.
segment.target: For example: ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ:1;ACCESS_VIOLATION_WRITE:1.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You should use this compatibility fix only if you are certain that it is acceptable to ignore the exception.
segment.target: You should use this compatibility fix only if you are certain that it is acceptable to ignore the exception.

segment.source: You might experience additional compatibility issues if you choose to incorrectly ignore an exception.
segment.target: You might experience additional compatibility issues if you choose to incorrectly ignore an exception.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the IgnoreException Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the IgnoreException Fix.

segment.source: IgnoreFloatingPointRoundingControl
segment.target: IgnoreFloatingPointRoundingControl

segment.source: This fix enables an application to ignore the rounding control request and to behave as expected in previous versions of the application.
segment.target: This fix enables an application to ignore the rounding control request and to behave as expected in previous versions of the application.

segment.source: Before floating point SSE2 support in the C runtime library, the rounding control request was being ignored which would use round to nearest option by default.
segment.target: Before floating point SSE2 support in the C runtime library, the rounding control request was being ignored which would use round to nearest option by default.

segment.source: This shim ignores the rounding control request to support applications relying on old behavior.
segment.target: This shim ignores the rounding control request to support applications relying on old behavior.

segment.source: IgnoreFontQuality
segment.target: IgnoreFontQuality

segment.source: The problem occurs when application text appears to be distorted.
segment.target: The problem occurs when application text appears to be distorted.

segment.source: The fix enables color-keyed fonts to properly work with anti-aliasing.
segment.target: The fix enables color-keyed fonts to properly work with anti-aliasing.

segment.source: IgnoreMessageBox
segment.target: IgnoreMessageBox

segment.source: The problem is indicated by a message box that displays with debugging or extraneous content when the application runs on an unexpected operating system.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by a message box that displays with debugging or extraneous content when the application runs on an unexpected operating system.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the MessageBox* APIs and inspects them for specific message text.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the MessageBox* APIs and inspects them for specific message text.

segment.source: If matching text is found, the application continues without showing the message box.
segment.target: If matching text is found, the application continues without showing the message box.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the IgnoreMessageBox Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the IgnoreMessageBox Fix.

segment.source: IgnoreMSOXMLMF
segment.target: IgnoreMSOXMLMF

segment.source: The problem is indicated by an error message that states that the operating system cannot locate the MSVCR80D.DLL file.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by an error message that states that the operating system cannot locate the MSVCR80D.DLL file.

segment.source: The fix ignores the registered MSOXMLMF.DLL object, which Microsoft® Office 2007 loads into the operating system any time that you load an XML file, and then it fails the CoGetClassObject for its CLSID.
segment.target: The fix ignores the registered MSOXMLMF.DLL object, which Microsoft® Office 2007 loads into the operating system any time that you load an XML file, and then it fails the CoGetClassObject for its CLSID.

segment.source: This compatibility fix will just ignore the registered MSOXMLMF and fail the CoGetClassObject for its CLSID.
segment.target: This compatibility fix will just ignore the registered MSOXMLMF and fail the CoGetClassObject for its CLSID.

segment.target: IgnoreSetROP2

segment.target: The fix ignores read-modify-write operations on the desktop to avoid performance issues.

segment.target: MakeShortcutRunas

segment.target: The problem is indicated when an application fails to uninstall because of access-related errors.

segment.target: The fix locates any RunDLL.exe-based uninstallers and forces them to run with different credentials during the application installation.

segment.source: After it applies this fix, the installer will create a shortcut that specifies a matching string to run during the application installation, thereby enabling the uninstallation to occur later.
segment.target: After it applies this fix, the installer will create a shortcut that specifies a matching string to run during the application installation, thereby enabling the uninstallation to occur later.

segment.target: Note

segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the MakeShortcutRunas Fix

segment.source: ManageLinks
segment.target: ManageLinks

segment.source: The fix intercepts common APIs that are going to a directory or to an executable (.exe) file, and then converts any symbolic or directory junctions before passing it back to the original APIs.
segment.target: The fix intercepts common APIs that are going to a directory or to an executable (.exe) file, and then converts any symbolic or directory junctions before passing it back to the original APIs.

segment.target: MirrorDriverWithComposition

segment.target: The fix allows mirror drivers to work properly with acceptable performance with desktop composition.

segment.source: MoveToCopyFileShim
segment.target: MoveToCopyFileShim

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application experiences security access issues during setup.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application experiences security access issues during setup.

segment.source: The fix forces the CopyFile APIs to run instead of the MoveFile APIs.
segment.target: The fix forces the CopyFile APIs to run instead of the MoveFile APIs.

segment.source: CopyFile APIs avoid moving the security descriptor, which enables the application files to get the default descriptor of the destination folder and prevents the security access issue.
segment.target: CopyFile APIs avoid moving the security descriptor, which enables the application files to get the default descriptor of the destination folder and prevents the security access issue.

segment.source: OpenDirectoryAcl
segment.target: OpenDirectoryAcl

segment.target: The problem is indicated by an error message that states that you do not have the appropriate permissions to access the application.

segment.target: The fix reduces the security privilege levels on a specified set of files and folders.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the OpenDirectoryACL Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the OpenDirectoryACL Fix.

segment.target: PopCapGamesForceResPerf

segment.target: The fix resolves the performance issues in PopCap games like Bejeweled2.

segment.target: The performance issues are visible in certain low-end cards at certain resolutions where the 1024x768 buffer is scaled to fit the display resolution.

segment.source: PreInstallDriver
segment.target: PreInstallDriver

segment.target: The fix preinstalls drivers for applications that would otherwise try to install or start drivers during the initial start process.

segment.source: PreInstallSmarteSECURE
segment.target: PreInstallSmarteSECURE

segment.target: The fix preinstalls computer-wide CLSIDs for applications that use SmartSECURE copy protection, which would otherwise try to install the CLSIDs during the initial start process.

segment.source: ProcessPerfData
segment.target: ProcessPerfData

segment.source: The problem is indicated by an Unhandled Exception error message because the application tried to read the process performance data registry value to determine if another instance of the application is running.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by an Unhandled Exception error message because the application tried to read the process performance data registry value to determine if another instance of the application is running.

segment.source: The fix handles the failure case by passing a fake process performance data registry key, so that the application perceives that it is the only instance running.
segment.target: The fix handles the failure case by passing a fake process performance data registry key, so that the application perceives that it is the only instance running.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This issue seems to occur most frequently with .NET applications.
segment.target: This issue seems to occur most frequently with .NET applications.

segment.source: PromoteDAM
segment.target: PromoteDAM

segment.source: The fix registers an application for power state change notifications.
segment.target: The fix registers an application for power state change notifications.

segment.source: PropagateProcessHistory
segment.target: PropagateProcessHistory

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application incorrectly fails to apply an application fix.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application incorrectly fails to apply an application fix.

segment.source: The fix sets the _PROCESS_HISTORY environment variable so that child processes can look in the parent directory for matching information while searching for application fixes.
segment.target: The fix sets the _PROCESS_HISTORY environment variable so that child processes can look in the parent directory for matching information while searching for application fixes.

segment.source: ProtectedAdminCheck
segment.target: ProtectedAdminCheck

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application fails to run because of incorrect Protected Administrator permissions.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails to run because of incorrect Protected Administrator permissions.

segment.source: The fix addresses the issues that occur when applications use non-standard Administrator checks, thereby generating false positives for user accounts that are being run as Protected Administrators.
segment.target: The fix addresses the issues that occur when applications use non-standard Administrator checks, thereby generating false positives for user accounts that are being run as Protected Administrators.

segment.source: In this case, the associated SID exists, but it is set as deny-only.
segment.target: In this case, the associated SID exists, but it is set as deny-only.

segment.source: RedirectCRTTempFile
segment.target: RedirectCRTTempFile

segment.target: The fix intercepts failing CRT calls that try to create a temporary file at the root of the volume, thereby redirecting the calls to a temporary file in the user's temporary directory.

segment.source: RedirectHKCUKeys
segment.target: RedirectHKCUKeys

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application cannot be accessed because of User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application cannot be accessed because of User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.

segment.source: The fix duplicates any newly created HKCU keys to other users' HKCU accounts.
segment.target: The fix duplicates any newly created HKCU keys to other users' HKCU accounts.

segment.source: This fix is generic for UAC restrictions, whereby the HKCU keys are required, but are unavailable to an application at runtime.
segment.target: This fix is generic for UAC restrictions, whereby the HKCU keys are required, but are unavailable to an application at runtime.

segment.source: RedirectMP3Codec
segment.target: RedirectMP3Codec

segment.source: This problem occurs when you cannot play MP3 files.
segment.target: This problem occurs when you cannot play MP3 files.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the CoCreateInstance call for the missing filter and then redirects it to a supported version.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the CoCreateInstance call for the missing filter and then redirects it to a supported version.

segment.source: RedirectShortcut
segment.target: RedirectShortcut

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application cannot be accessed by its shortcut, or application shortcuts are not removed during the application uninstallation process.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application cannot be accessed by its shortcut, or application shortcuts are not removed during the application uninstallation process.

segment.source: The fix redirects all of the shortcuts created during the application setup to appear according to a specified path.
segment.target: The fix redirects all of the shortcuts created during the application setup to appear according to a specified path.

segment.source: Start Menu shortcuts: Appear in the ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu directory for all users.
segment.target: Start Menu shortcuts: Appear in the ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu directory for all users.

segment.source: Desktop or Quick Launch shortcuts:You must manually place the shortcuts on the individual user's desktop or Quick Launch bar.
segment.target: Desktop or Quick Launch shortcuts:You must manually place the shortcuts on the individual user's desktop or Quick Launch bar.

segment.source: This issue occurs because of UAC restrictions: specifically, when an application setup runs by using elevated privileges and stores the shortcuts according to the elevated user's context.
segment.target: This issue occurs because of UAC restrictions: specifically, when an application setup runs by using elevated privileges and stores the shortcuts according to the elevated user's context.

segment.source: In this situation, a restricted user cannot access the shortcuts.
segment.target: In this situation, a restricted user cannot access the shortcuts.

segment.source: You cannot apply this fix to an .exe file that includes a manifest and provides a runlevel.
segment.target: You cannot apply this fix to an .exe file that includes a manifest and provides a runlevel.

segment.source: RelaunchElevated
segment.target: RelaunchElevated

segment.source: The problem occurs when installers, uninstallers, or updaters fail when they are started from a host application.
segment.target: The problem occurs when installers, uninstallers, or updaters fail when they are started from a host application.

segment.source: The fix enables a child .exe file to run with elevated privileges when it is difficult to determine the parent process with either the ElevateCreateProcess fix or by marking the .exe files to RunAsAdmin.
segment.target: The fix enables a child .exe file to run with elevated privileges when it is difficult to determine the parent process with either the ElevateCreateProcess fix or by marking the .exe files to RunAsAdmin.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RelaunchElevated Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RelaunchElevated Fix.

segment.source: RetryOpenSCManagerWithReadAccess
segment.target: RetryOpenSCManagerWithReadAccess

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application tries to open the Service Control Manager (SCM) and receives an Access Denied error message.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application tries to open the Service Control Manager (SCM) and receives an Access Denied error message.

segment.source: The fix retries the call and requests a more restricted set of rights that include the following:
segment.target: The fix retries the call and requests a more restricted set of rights that include the following:

segment.source: SC_MANAGER_CONNECT
segment.target: SC_MANAGER_CONNECT

segment.source: SC_MANAGER_ENUMERATE_SERVICE
segment.target: SC_MANAGER_ENUMERATE_SERVICE

segment.source: SC_MANAGER_QUERY_LOCK_STATUS
segment.target: SC_MANAGER_QUERY_LOCK_STATUS

segment.source: STANDARD_READ_RIGHTS
segment.target: STANDARD_READ_RIGHTS

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RetryOpenSCManagerwithReadAccess Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RetryOpenSCManagerwithReadAccess Fix.

segment.source: RetryOpenServiceWithReadAccess
segment.target: RetryOpenServiceWithReadAccess

segment.source: The problem occurs when an Unable to open service due to your application using the OpenService() API to test for the existence of a particular service error message displays.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an Unable to open service due to your application using the OpenService() API to test for the existence of a particular service error message displays.

segment.source: The fix retries the OpenService() API call and verifies that the user has Administrator rights, is not a Protected Administrator, and by using read-only access.
segment.target: The fix retries the OpenService() API call and verifies that the user has Administrator rights, is not a Protected Administrator, and by using read-only access.

segment.source: Applications can test for the existence of a service by calling the OpenService() API but some applications ask for all access when making this check.
segment.target: Applications can test for the existence of a service by calling the OpenService() API but some applications ask for all access when making this check.

segment.source: This fix retries the call but only asking for read-only access.
segment.target: This fix retries the call but only asking for read-only access.

segment.source: The user needs to be an administrator for this to work
segment.target: The user needs to be an administrator for this to work

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RetryOpenServiceWithReadAccess Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RetryOpenServiceWithReadAccess Fix.

segment.source: RunAsAdmin
segment.target: RunAsAdmin

segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails to function by using the Standard User or Protected Administrator account.

segment.target: The fix enables the application to run by using elevated privileges.

segment.source: The fix is the equivalent of specifying requireAdministrator in an application manifest.
segment.target: The fix is the equivalent of specifying requireAdministrator in an application manifest.

segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RunAsAdmin Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RunAsAdmin Fix.

segment.target: RunAsHighest

segment.target: The problem occurs when administrators cannot view the read/write version of an application that presents a read-only view to standard users.

segment.target: The fix enables the application to run by using the highest available permissions.

segment.target: This is the equivalent of specifying highestAvailable in an application manifest.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RunAsHighest Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RunAsHighest Fix.

segment.target: RunAsInvoker

segment.target: The problem occurs when an application is not detected as requiring elevation.

segment.target: The fix enables the application to run by using the privileges that are associated with the creation process, without requiring elevation.

segment.source: This is the equivalent of specifying asInvoker in an application manifest.
segment.target: This is the equivalent of specifying asInvoker in an application manifest.

segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the RunAsInvoker Fix.
