segment.source: The fix repairs applications by using SecuROM7 for copy protection.
segment.target: The fix repairs applications by using SecuROM7 for copy protection.

segment.source: SessionShim
segment.target: SessionShim

segment.source: The fix intercepts API calls from applications that are trying to interact with services that are running in another session, by using the terminal service name prefix (Global or Local) as the parameter.
segment.target: The fix intercepts API calls from applications that are trying to interact with services that are running in another session, by using the terminal service name prefix (Global or Local) as the parameter.

segment.source: At the command prompt, you can supply a list of objects to modify, separating the values by a double backslash (.
segment.target: At the command prompt, you can supply a list of objects to modify, separating the values by a double backslash (.

segment.source: Or, you can choose not to include any parameters, so that all of the objects are modified.
segment.target: Or, you can choose not to include any parameters, so that all of the objects are modified.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Users cannot log in as Session 0 (Global Session) in Windows Vista and later.
segment.target: Users cannot log in as Session 0 (Global Session) in Windows Vista and later.

segment.source: Therefore, applications that require access to Session 0 automatically fail.
segment.target: Therefore, applications that require access to Session 0 automatically fail.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the SessionShim Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the SessionShim Fix.

segment.source: SetProtocolHandler
segment.target: SetProtocolHandler

segment.source: The fix registers an application as a protocol handler.
segment.target: The fix registers an application as a protocol handler.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: Client;Protocol;App
segment.target: Client;Protocol;App

segment.source: Where the Client is the name of the email protocol, Protocol is mailto, and App is the name of the application.
segment.target: Where the Client is the name of the email protocol, Protocol is mailto, and App is the name of the application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Only the mail client and the mailto protocol are supported.
segment.target: Only the mail client and the mailto protocol are supported.

segment.source: You can separate multiple clients by using a backslash ().
segment.target: You can separate multiple clients by using a backslash ().

segment.source: SetupCommitFileQueueIgnoreWow
segment.target: SetupCommitFileQueueIgnoreWow

segment.source: The problem occurs when a 32-bit setup program fails to install because it requires 64-bit drivers.
segment.target: The problem occurs when a 32-bit setup program fails to install because it requires 64-bit drivers.

segment.source: The fix disables the Wow64 file system that is used by the 64-bit editions of Windows, to prevent 32-bit applications from accessing 64-bit file systems during the application setup.
segment.target: The fix disables the Wow64 file system that is used by the 64-bit editions of Windows, to prevent 32-bit applications from accessing 64-bit file systems during the application setup.

segment.source: SharePointDesigner2007
segment.target: SharePointDesigner2007

segment.source: The fix resolves an application bug that severely slows the application when it runs in DWM.
segment.target: The fix resolves an application bug that severely slows the application when it runs in DWM.

segment.source: ShimViaEAT
segment.target: ShimViaEAT

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application fails, even after applying acompatibility fix that is known to fix an issue.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails, even after applying acompatibility fix that is known to fix an issue.

segment.source: Applications that use unicows.dll or copy protection often present this issue.
segment.target: Applications that use unicows.dll or copy protection often present this issue.

segment.source: The fix applies the specified compatibility fixes by modifying the export table and by nullifying the use of module inclusion and exclusion.
segment.target: The fix applies the specified compatibility fixes by modifying the export table and by nullifying the use of module inclusion and exclusion.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about this application fix, see Using the ShimViaEAT Fix.
segment.target: For more information about this application fix, see Using the ShimViaEAT Fix.

segment.source: ShowWindowIE
segment.target: ShowWindowIE

segment.source: The problem occurs when a web application experiences navigation and display issues because of the tabbing feature.
segment.target: The problem occurs when a web application experiences navigation and display issues because of the tabbing feature.

segment.source: The fix intercepts the ShowWindow API call to address the issues that can occur when a web application determines that it is in a child window.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the ShowWindow API call to address the issues that can occur when a web application determines that it is in a child window.

segment.source: This fix calls the real ShowWindow API on the top-level parent window.
segment.target: This fix calls the real ShowWindow API on the top-level parent window.

segment.source: SierraWirelessHideCDROM
segment.target: SierraWirelessHideCDROM

segment.source: The fix repairs the Sierra Wireless Driver installation, thereby preventing bugcheck.
segment.target: The fix repairs the Sierra Wireless Driver installation, thereby preventing bugcheck.

segment.source: Sonique2
segment.target: Sonique2

segment.source: The application uses an invalid window style, which breaks in DWM.
segment.target: The application uses an invalid window style, which breaks in DWM.

segment.source: This fix replaces the window style with a valid value.
segment.target: This fix replaces the window style with a valid value.

segment.source: SpecificInstaller
segment.target: SpecificInstaller

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application installation file fails to be picked up by the GenericInstaller function.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application installation file fails to be picked up by the GenericInstaller function.

segment.source: The fix flags the application as being an installer file (for example, setup.exe), and then prompts for elevation.
segment.target: The fix flags the application as being an installer file (for example, setup.exe), and then prompts for elevation.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the SpecificInstaller Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the SpecificInstaller Fix.

segment.source: SpecificNonInstaller
segment.target: SpecificNonInstaller

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application that is not an installer (and has sufficient privileges) generates a false positive from the GenericInstaller function.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application that is not an installer (and has sufficient privileges) generates a false positive from the GenericInstaller function.

segment.source: The fix flags the application to exclude it from detection by the GenericInstaller function.
segment.target: The fix flags the application to exclude it from detection by the GenericInstaller function.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the SpecificNonInstaller Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the SpecificNonInstaller Fix.

segment.source: SystemMetricsLie
segment.target: SystemMetricsLie

segment.source: The fix replaces SystemMetrics values and SystemParametersInfo values with the values of previous Windows versions.
segment.target: The fix replaces SystemMetrics values and SystemParametersInfo values with the values of previous Windows versions.

segment.source: TextArt
segment.target: TextArt

segment.source: The application receives different mouse coordinates with DWM ON versus DWM OFF, which causes the application to hang.
segment.target: The application receives different mouse coordinates with DWM ON versus DWM OFF, which causes the application to hang.

segment.source: This fix resolves the issue.
segment.target: This fix resolves the issue.

segment.source: TrimDisplayDeviceNames
segment.target: TrimDisplayDeviceNames

segment.source: The fix trims the names of the display devices that are returned by the EnumDisplayDevices API.
segment.target: The fix trims the names of the display devices that are returned by the EnumDisplayDevices API.

segment.source: UIPICompatLogging
segment.target: UIPICompatLogging

segment.source: The fix enables the logging of Windows messages from Internet Explorer and other processes.
segment.target: The fix enables the logging of Windows messages from Internet Explorer and other processes.

segment.source: UIPIEnableCustomMsgs
segment.target: UIPIEnableCustomMsgs

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application does not properly communicate with other processes because customized Windows messages are not delivered.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application does not properly communicate with other processes because customized Windows messages are not delivered.

segment.source: The fix enables customized Windows messages to pass through to the current process from a lower Desktop integrity level.
segment.target: The fix enables customized Windows messages to pass through to the current process from a lower Desktop integrity level.

segment.source: This fix is the equivalent of calling the RegisterWindowMessage function, followed by the ChangeWindowMessageFilter function in the code.
segment.target: This fix is the equivalent of calling the RegisterWindowMessage function, followed by the ChangeWindowMessageFilter function in the code.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: MessageString1 MessageString2
segment.target: MessageString1 MessageString2

segment.source: Where MessageString1 and MessageString2 reflect the message strings that can pass.
segment.target: Where MessageString1 and MessageString2 reflect the message strings that can pass.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Multiple message strings must be separated by spaces.
segment.target: Multiple message strings must be separated by spaces.

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the UIPIEnableCustomMsgs Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the UIPIEnableCustomMsgs Fix.

segment.source: UIPIEnableStandardMsgs
segment.target: UIPIEnableStandardMsgs

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application does not communicate properly with other processes because standard Windows messages are not delivered.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application does not communicate properly with other processes because standard Windows messages are not delivered.

segment.source: The fix enables standard Windows messages to pass through to the current process from a lower Desktop integrity level.
segment.target: The fix enables standard Windows messages to pass through to the current process from a lower Desktop integrity level.

segment.source: This fix is the equivalent of calling the ChangeWindowMessageFilter function in the code.
segment.target: This fix is the equivalent of calling the ChangeWindowMessageFilter function in the code.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: Where 1055 reflects the first message ID, 1056 reflects the second message ID, and 1069 reflects the third message ID that can pass.
segment.target: Where 1055 reflects the first message ID, 1056 reflects the second message ID, and 1069 reflects the third message ID that can pass.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Multiple messages can be separated by spaces.
segment.target: Multiple messages can be separated by spaces.

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the UIPIEnableStandardMsgs Fix [act].
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the UIPIEnableStandardMsgs Fix [act].

segment.source: VirtualizeDeleteFileLayer
segment.target: VirtualizeDeleteFileLayer

segment.source: The fix virtualizes DeleteFile operations for applications that try to delete protected files.
segment.target: The fix virtualizes DeleteFile operations for applications that try to delete protected files.

segment.source: VirtualizeDesktopPainting
segment.target: VirtualizeDesktopPainting

segment.source: This fix improves the performance of a number of operations on the Desktop DC while using DWM.
segment.target: This fix improves the performance of a number of operations on the Desktop DC while using DWM.

segment.source: VirtualRegistry
segment.target: VirtualRegistry

segment.source: The problem is indicated when a Component failed to be located error message displays when an application is started.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when a Component failed to be located error message displays when an application is started.

segment.source: The fix enables the registry functions to allow for virtualization, redirection, expansion values, version spoofing, the simulation of performance data counters, and so on.
segment.target: The fix enables the registry functions to allow for virtualization, redirection, expansion values, version spoofing, the simulation of performance data counters, and so on.

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualRegistry Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualRegistry Fix.

segment.source: VirtualizeDeleteFile
segment.target: VirtualizeDeleteFile

segment.source: The problem occurs when several error messages display and the application cannot delete files.
segment.target: The problem occurs when several error messages display and the application cannot delete files.

segment.source: The fix makes the application's DeleteFile function call a virtual call in an effort to remedy the UAC and file virtualization issues that were introduced with Windows Vista.
segment.target: The fix makes the application's DeleteFile function call a virtual call in an effort to remedy the UAC and file virtualization issues that were introduced with Windows Vista.

segment.source: This fix also links other file APIs (for example, GetFileAttributes) to ensure that the virtualization of the file is deleted.
segment.target: This fix also links other file APIs (for example, GetFileAttributes) to ensure that the virtualization of the file is deleted.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualizeDeleteFile Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualizeDeleteFile Fix.

segment.source: VirtualizeHKCRLite
segment.target: VirtualizeHKCRLite

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application fails to register COM components at runtime.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails to register COM components at runtime.

segment.source: The fix redirects the HKCR write calls (HKLM) to the HKCU hive for a per-user COM registration.
segment.target: The fix redirects the HKCR write calls (HKLM) to the HKCU hive for a per-user COM registration.

segment.source: This operates much like the VirtualRegistry fix when you use the VirtualizeHKCR parameter; however, VirtualizeHKCRLite provides better performance.
segment.target: This operates much like the VirtualRegistry fix when you use the VirtualizeHKCR parameter; however, VirtualizeHKCRLite provides better performance.

segment.source: HKCR is a virtual merge of the HKCU\Software\Classes and HKLM\Software\Classes directories.
segment.target: HKCR is a virtual merge of the HKCU\Software\Classes and HKLM\Software\Classes directories.

segment.source: The use of HKCU is preferred if an application is not elevated and is ignored if the application is elevated.
segment.target: The use of HKCU is preferred if an application is not elevated and is ignored if the application is elevated.

segment.source: You typically will use this compatibility fix in conjunction with the VirtualizeRegisterTypeLib fix.
segment.target: You typically will use this compatibility fix in conjunction with the VirtualizeRegisterTypeLib fix.

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualizeHKCRLite Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualizeHKCRLite Fix.

segment.source: VirtualizeRegisterTypeLib
segment.target: VirtualizeRegisterTypeLib

segment.source: The fix, when it is used with the VirtualizeHKCRLite fix, ensures that the type library and the COM class registration happen simultaneously.
segment.target: The fix, when it is used with the VirtualizeHKCRLite fix, ensures that the type library and the COM class registration happen simultaneously.

segment.source: This functions much like the RegistryTypeLib fix when the RegisterTypeLibForUser parameter is used.
segment.target: This functions much like the RegistryTypeLib fix when the RegisterTypeLibForUser parameter is used.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualizeRegisterTypelib Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the VirtualizeRegisterTypelib Fix.

segment.source: WaveOutIgnoreBadFormat
segment.target: WaveOutIgnoreBadFormat

segment.source: This problem is indicated by an error message that states: Unable to initialize sound device from your audio driver; the application then closes.
segment.target: This problem is indicated by an error message that states: Unable to initialize sound device from your audio driver; the application then closes.

segment.source: The fix enables the application to ignore the format error and continue to function properly.
segment.target: The fix enables the application to ignore the format error and continue to function properly.

segment.source: WerDisableReportException
segment.target: WerDisableReportException

segment.source: The fix turns off the silent reporting of exceptions to the Windows Error Reporting tool, including those that are reported by Object Linking and Embedding-Database (OLE DB).
segment.target: The fix turns off the silent reporting of exceptions to the Windows Error Reporting tool, including those that are reported by Object Linking and Embedding-Database (OLE DB).

segment.source: The fix intercepts the RtlReportException API and returns a STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED error message.
segment.target: The fix intercepts the RtlReportException API and returns a STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED error message.

segment.source: Win7RTM/Win8RTM
segment.target: Win7RTM/Win8RTM

segment.source: The layer provides the application with Windows 7/Windows 8 compatibility mode.
segment.target: The layer provides the application with Windows 7/Windows 8 compatibility mode.

segment.source: WinxxRTMVersionLie
segment.target: WinxxRTMVersionLie

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application fails because it does not find the correct version number for the required Windows operating system.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application fails because it does not find the correct version number for the required Windows operating system.

segment.source: All version lie compatibility fixes address the issue whereby an application fails to function because it is checking for, but not finding, a specific version of the operating system.
segment.target: All version lie compatibility fixes address the issue whereby an application fails to function because it is checking for, but not finding, a specific version of the operating system.

segment.source: The version lie fix returns the appropriate operating system version information.
segment.target: The version lie fix returns the appropriate operating system version information.

segment.source: For example, the VistaRTMVersionLie returns the Windows Vista version information to the application, regardless of the actual operating system version that is running on the computer.
segment.target: For example, the VistaRTMVersionLie returns the Windows Vista version information to the application, regardless of the actual operating system version that is running on the computer.

segment.source: Wing32SystoSys32
segment.target: Wing32SystoSys32

segment.source: The problem is indicated by an error message that states that the WinG library was not properly installed.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by an error message that states that the WinG library was not properly installed.

segment.source: The fix detects whether the WinG32 library exists in the correct directory.
segment.target: The fix detects whether the WinG32 library exists in the correct directory.

segment.source: If the library is located in the wrong location, this fix copies the information (typically during the runtime of the application) into the %WINDIR% \system32 directory.
segment.target: If the library is located in the wrong location, this fix copies the information (typically during the runtime of the application) into the %WINDIR% \system32 directory.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The application must have Administrator privileges for this fix to work.
segment.target: The application must have Administrator privileges for this fix to work.

segment.source: WinSrv08R2RTM
segment.target: WinSrv08R2RTM

segment.source: WinXPSP2VersionLie
segment.target: WinXPSP2VersionLie

segment.source: The problem occurs when an application experiences issues because of a VB runtime DLL.
segment.target: The problem occurs when an application experiences issues because of a VB runtime DLL.

segment.source: The fix forces the application to follow these steps:
segment.target: The fix forces the application to follow these steps:

segment.source: Open the Compatibility Administrator, and then select None for Operating System Mode.
segment.target: Open the Compatibility Administrator, and then select None for Operating System Mode.

segment.source: On the Compatibility Fixes page, click WinXPSP2VersionLie, and then click Parameters.
segment.target: On the Compatibility Fixes page, click WinXPSP2VersionLie, and then click Parameters.

segment.source: The Options for fix_name dialog box appears.
segment.target: The Options for fix_name dialog box appears.

segment.source: Type vbrun60.dll into the Module Name box, click Include, and then click Add.
segment.target: Type vbrun60.dll into the Module Name box, click Include, and then click Add.

segment.source: Save the custom database.
segment.target: Save the custom database.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about the WinXPSP2VersionLie application fix, see Using the WinXPSP2VersionLie Fix.
segment.target: For more information about the WinXPSP2VersionLie application fix, see Using the WinXPSP2VersionLie Fix.

segment.source: WRPDllRegister
segment.target: WRPDllRegister

segment.source: The application fails when it tries to register a COM component that is released together with Windows Vista and later.
segment.target: The application fails when it tries to register a COM component that is released together with Windows Vista and later.

segment.source: The fix skips the processes of registering and unregistering WRP-protected COM components when calling the DLLRegisterServer and DLLUnregisterServer functions.
segment.target: The fix skips the processes of registering and unregistering WRP-protected COM components when calling the DLLRegisterServer and DLLUnregisterServer functions.

segment.source: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:
segment.target: You can control this fix further by typing the following command at the command prompt:

segment.source: Component1.dll;Component2.dll
segment.target: Component1.dll;Component2.dll

segment.source: Where Component1.dll and Component2.dll reflect the components to be skipped.
segment.target: Where Component1.dll and Component2.dll reflect the components to be skipped.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the WRPDllRegister Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about this application fix, see Using the WRPDllRegister Fix.

segment.source: WRPMitigation
segment.target: WRPMitigation

segment.source: The problem is indicated when an access denied error message displays when the application tries to access a protected operating system resource by using more than read-only access.
segment.target: The problem is indicated when an access denied error message displays when the application tries to access a protected operating system resource by using more than read-only access.

segment.source: The fix emulates the successful authentication and modification of file and registry APIs, so that the application can continue.
segment.target: The fix emulates the successful authentication and modification of file and registry APIs, so that the application can continue.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more detailed information about WRPMitigation, see Using the WRPMitigation Fix.
segment.target: For more detailed information about WRPMitigation, see Using the WRPMitigation Fix.

segment.source: WRPRegDeleteKey
segment.target: WRPRegDeleteKey

segment.source: The problem is indicated by an access denied error message that displays when the application tries to delete a registry key.
segment.target: The problem is indicated by an access denied error message that displays when the application tries to delete a registry key.

segment.source: The fix verifies whether the registry key is WRP-protected.
segment.target: The fix verifies whether the registry key is WRP-protected.

segment.source: If the key is protected, this fix emulates the deletion process.
segment.target: If the key is protected, this fix emulates the deletion process.

segment.source: XPAfxIsValidAddress
segment.target: XPAfxIsValidAddress

segment.source: The fix emulates the behavior of Windows XP for MFC42!AfxIsValidAddress.
segment.target: The fix emulates the behavior of Windows XP for MFC42!AfxIsValidAddress.
